en.purpose: To provide decision support for diagnosing Functional Anorectal Pain by applying the Rome IV diagnostic criteria in clinical practice.
en.use:
Use to record the structured evaluation of patients suspected of having Functional Anorectal Pain, including:

Symptom duration of ≥3 months, onset ≥6 months before diagnosis.

Proctalgia Fugax: Brief, episodic pain with no persistent discomfort between episodes.

Levator Ani Syndrome: Persistent deep anorectal pain lasting ≥30 minutes, often worsened by prolonged sitting.

Exclusion of structural, neurological, or inflammatory causes through clinical evaluation and diagnostic testing.
en.misuse: Not to be used for anorectal pain due to identifiable causes, such as hemorrhoids, rectal fissures, abscesses, infections, IBD, or malignancies. Use instead the appropriate guideline for those conditions.

other_details.en: Clinical guideline to assist in recording and evaluating the Rome IV criteria for Functional Anorectal Pain, including its two main subtypes: proctalgia fugax and levator ani syndrome.
